justification: The authors state: "Inspired by Dubois et al., we did measure individual impulsivity using the Barrat Impulsivity scale (BIS-11) (72)."

measured_by: Horizon Task – equal-information trials (slope of choice curve)
justification: "In the horizon task, the agent's vulnerability to round-to-round variability i.e., random exploration, is captured by how often they choose the lower-value machine in equal information rounds…the slope…gives us an estimate…with higher values indicating less random exploration."

measured_by: Horizon Task – unequal-information trials (rate of choosing more informative option)
justification: "To measure the tendency to prioritize gaining more information about the less well known choice options…we focused on the unequal information condition in the horizon task. We compared the rate of choosing the more informative bandit…Directed exploration rate was higher in the long horizon."

measured_by: Horizon Task – accuracy difference between short horizon and first trial of long horizon
justification: "In the horizon task, the difference between choice accuracy in the short horizon and in the first trial of the long horizon constitutes a measure of overall exploration."
